intro: Myrsine capororoca, commonly known as the Peruvian myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Peru and Ecuador. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy, dark green surface. The small, white flowers are followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various bird species.
